   955.01 DEFINITIONS.
   For the purposes of this chapter, the words and phrases set forth
hereinbelow shall have and be afforded the meaning and definition ascribed to
each of the same respectively.
(1)   "Bulky waste items" means major household appliances, including, but not
by way of limitation, refrigerators, washers, dryers, hot water tanks, cooking
stoves, dishwashers, and televisions; furniture, trees and limbs of trees,
stumps, brush, and logs; and construction and demolition waste and debris as
well as other items which may be determined by the City Manager from time to
time as being bulky waste items.
(2)   "City Manager" means the City Manager, or other Chief Executive Officer
of the City of Sandusky, Ohio, or the representative duly authorized by said
individual to act in behalf thereof.
(3)   "Commercial establishments" means business establishments engaged in the
purchase and sale, and/or barter of commodities including, but not by way of
limitation stores, markets, and restaurants and other establishments maintained
for the provision of food and beverages for human consumption, hotels, motels,
automotive service stations, and all such similar establishments.
(4)   "Commercial hauler" means any person who is engaged on a full-time or
part-time basis, permanently or temporarily, in the process and activity of
collecting, conveying and/or disposing of solid waste, garbage, refuse,
compostable material, bulky waste items, recyclable materials or recyclables,
and/or other discarded material which have been accumulated within the City of
Sandusky, Ohio, in connection with a residential, but not an industrial or
commercial use other than that actually produced by said person or in direct
connection to a premises of which said person is the owner or an occupant.
Further, "commercial hauler" does not include any person who is engaged solely
in the provision, maintenance, collection, and removal of dumpsters and/or
roll-off containers which are utilized solely for the collection, storage,
conveyance, and removal of construction and/or demolition debris, scrap metal,
stone, and dirt generated or created, and collected at the site or location of
said dumpster or container.
(5)   "Compostable material" means trees, limbs of trees, logs, leaves,
branches, clippings, grass, vegetation, and any other material which is subject
to processing as part of a composting process for the purpose of recycling the
same.
(6)   “Composting process" means the procedure and activity of processing
compostable materials so as to reduce the volume thereof, and/or modify the
nature, content, makeup, and composition thereof so as to render said material
practically usable or reusable for recycling purposes.
(7)   "Curb" means the boulevard, tree lawn or devil strip, or any other area
of a property between a public street or alley and the front or facing of any
building or structure which occupies the property, but excluding any public
street, alley, sidewalk, or walkway, and any driveway.
(8)   "Curbside collection" means the process or activity of placing properly
packaged or contained garbage, solid waste, refuse, compostable material, other
discarded material, and/or recyclables, for the purpose of the collection and
conveyance thereof by commercial haulers, upon a curb.
(9)   "Collection," "commercial collection," or "commercial collection
activities" means the process or activity effected and/or undertaken by
commercial haulers of collecting and/or conveying garbage, solid waste, bulky
waste items, refuse, compostable material, other discardable material, and/or
recyclables other than that actually produced by said person or in direct
connection to the premises of which said person is the owner or an occupant, in
compliance with and pursuant to this chapter.
(10)   "Curbside collection map" means a map depicting and illustrating the
five (5) curbside collection zones within the City of Sandusky, Ohio, within
each of which the properly packaged or contained garbage, solid waste, refuse,
compostable material, bulky waste items, and/or other discarded material, and/
or recyclables may be collected and conveyed by commercial haulers on one (1)
designated day of each week in compliance with, and pursuant to the terms and
provisions of this chapter.
(11)   “Curbside collection zones" means the five (5) geographic areas within
the City of Sandusky, Ohio, as depicted and illustrated by the collection map,
within which collection shall be permitted by licensed commercial haulers on
one weekday each week in compliance with and pursuant to this chapter.
(12)   "Disposal unit" means any incinerator that will effectively reduce all
nonmetallic and similar noncombustible materials to an ash that is inert from
the standpoint of the intent of this chapter as well as any comminutor or
garbage grinder that is attached to the sanitary disposal system in any
structure, providing that said apparatus conforms to the regulations contained
within the Sewer Ordinances of the City.
(13)   "Garbage" means all putrescible wastes except wastes of the human body,
other water carried wastes and infectious wastes as-defined in Section 3734.01
(R) of the Ohio Revised Code or any subsequent amendment thereof or
modification thereto, including, but not by way of limitation, all vegetable
and animal wastes resulting from the handling, preparation, and cooking of
foods, and any unwashed containers that previously contained food or liquid
prepared or proposed for human or animal consumption.
(14)   "Ground" means the earth, as well as the surface of a driveway, a
sidewalk, a floor, or any other surface on, in or about real property on or in
which garbage or other refuse may be placed, deposited, kept, accumulated, and/
or stored.
(15)   "Health Commissioner" means the individual appointed by the Board of
Health of jurisdiction within the City of Sandusky, Ohio, to serve, either
permanently or temporarily, as the Executive Officer of said Board, or the
representative duly authorized by said Executive Officer to act in behalf
thereof.
(16)   "Refuse" or "other refuse" means ashes, crockery, bottles, tin cans,
paper and other wood pulp products, boxes, rags, old or discarded clothing,
bedding, mattresses and upholstered furniture, and all other similar
nonputrescible wastes and discarded materials not otherwise defined herein.
(17)   "Person" means the state of Ohio or any political subdivision, agency,
office or enterprise thereof, any corporation, public or private, and any
individual, partnership or other entity.
(18)   "Premises" means any land building or structure on or in which solid
waste may be placed, deposited, kept, accumulated, and/or stored.
(19)   "Ratguard" means a smooth metallic device that will effectively prevent
rodents from climbing to places where foodstuffs may be legally placed,
deposited, kept, and/or stored out of doors, including, but not by way of
limitation, feeding stations for wild birds.
(20)   "Ratproof" or "ratproofing" means as applied to buildings, any
stipulation related to the prevention of the presence or infestation of rodents
which is presently contained within the Building Codes of the City of Sandusky,
Ohio, or which may be added thereto hereafter.
(21)   "Recyclable materials or recyclables" means cardboard, corrugated paper,
container glass, plastics, and aluminum and bi-metal beverage cans, and
newsprint.
(23)   "Recycling" or "recycling services" means the process of collecting,
sorting cleansing, treating, and/or reconstituting waste, garbage, refuse or
other discarded material for the purpose of recovering, using or reusing the
same.
(24)   "Recycling program" or "recycling services" means an ongoing process or
procedure which provides for, permits, facilitates, and allows the collection,
conveyance and disposition of recyclable materials or recyclables produced,
generated and/or accumulated within the City of Sandusky, Ohio, for the purpose
of recycling the same.
(25)   "Residence" means any enclosure, other than those kept, maintained, or
operated solely as commercial or industrial establishments, used as a human
domicile, including, but not by way of limitation, multiple and single-family
dwellings, mobile homes and house trailers, living quarters within and/or
attached to boathouse structures or boatports, camps, and any other structure
within which humans may sleep, or prepare or consume food.
(26)   "Rodent" means any mouse, rat, or other animal that falls within that
biological category excluding certain such animals which are kept as
furbearers, or pets, or for clinical or research purposes, providing they are
kept or confined in a manner satisfactory to the Health Commissioner.
(27)   "Solid waste" means such unwanted residual solid or semisolid material
as results from industrial, commercial, agricultural, and community operations,
excluding earth or material from construction, mining, or demolition
operations, or other waste materials of a type that would normally be included
in demolition debris, nontoxic fly ash, spent nontoxic foundry sand, and slag
and other substances that are not harmful or inimical to public health, and
including, but not by way of limitation, garbage, tires, combustible and
noncombustible material, street dirt, and debris, and excluding any material
that is an infectious waste or a hazardous waste. To the extent that the same
is appropriate and reasonably consistent with the terms and provisions of this
chapter "solid waste", "garbage", "refuse", and "compostable materials" shall
be interchangeable, and shall have and be afforded the same meaning hereunder.
(28)   "Licensed commercial hauler" means any person engaged in commercial
hauling activities within the City of Sandusky, Ohio, who has secured a license
permitting him to afford said services or to engage in said activity in
compliance with this chapter, and which license is current and in effect.
      (Ord. 10-055. Passed 6-28-10.)
   955.02 IMPROPER DISPOSAL OF GARBAGE AND WASTES.
   No person shall place or deposit or permit to be placed or deposited
garbage, offal, or any other putrescible refuse of vegetable, animal, fish, or
fowl origin, or any other combustible or noncombustible wastes, in any street,
alley, road, open excavation, abandoned well or cistern, ditch, stream or body
of water, or on the surface of the ground, or in any other manner deemed
improper by the Department of Health.
(Ord. 10-055. Passed 6-28-10.)
   955.03 HOG FEEDING OF COLLECTED GARBAGE PROHIBITED.
   No person shall transport, deliver, or deposit, to or within the territory
under the jurisdiction of the City, collected garbage for the purpose of
feeding the same in part or in whole to hogs. For the purpose of this
regulation, "collected garbage" means garbage collected by one or more
individuals, from any other person, residence or business place for the purpose
of feeding the garbage to hogs within the jurisdiction of the City. This
regulation shall not be construed to mean the prohibition of individual farmers
or other persons from feeding their own garbage to their own hogs.
(Ord. 10-055. Passed 6-28-10.)
   955.04  DISPOSAL; APPROVAL OF CITY REQUIRED.
   It shall be unlawful to collect and dispose of commercial and domestic
garbage by spreading on the ground and plowing under, or by trenching, or by
deep fill method by any municipal corporation or other political subdivision,
person or corporation within the City except when the disposition and location
is approved by the Board of Health.
(Ord. 10-055. Passed 6-28-10.)
   955.05 STORAGE AND COLLECTION OF SOLID WASTE.
   (a)   Premise maintenance. No person shall store, place, burn, or dispose on
his premises or the premises of another or permit to accumulate on his
premises, any solid waste in such a manner whereby it will become a rodent or
insect harborage or breeding place, or create a health menace, unsanitary
condition, or nuisance.
   (b)   Registration certificate required for solid waste collection.
      (1)   No person shall engage in the business of solid waste collection
for compensation, or as a required or voluntary service for others, unless he
possesses a valid registration certificate issued by the City Manager.
      (2)   The City Manager shall issue registration certificates to collect
solid waste only to persons having proper equipment, as required by this
section, and personnel for collecting of solid waste, and agreeing to comply
with all conditions of issuance or possession of the registration certificate
and otherwise complying with the requirements of this section.
      (3)   Any person intending to collect solid waste shall make written
application for a registration certificate to the City on a form provided by
the City Manager. Such application shall contain the name and address of such
person, a description of the equipment to be used in the collection of such
solid waste, the area where solid waste collections are to be made, and such
other information as the City Manager determines will reasonably aid in the
administration and enforcement of this section.
Applicant shall provide proof that all vehicles used by the applicant for the
collection and transportation of solid waste have passed an annual inspection
conducted by the Health Commissioner. The inspection shall be arranged by the
applicant.
      (4)    On approval of such application and the determination that the
applicant has the proper equipment in good condition, and personnel to meet the
requirements of this section, the City Manager shall issue a registration
certificate to the applicant. The City Manager may state on the registration
certificate or by a writing attached to the registration certificate the
conditions under which it is issued to insure the proper collection of all
solid waste in accordance with this section. The permit fee per vehicle,
payable annually to the City for the purpose of inspection, administration, and
enforcement of this section shall be as set forth by the City Manager and
approved by the City Commission. One half of the permit fee collected shall be
paid by the City to the Board of Health.
      (5)   The City Manager may revoke or suspend the registration certificate
of any person to collect solid waste who has demonstrated inability or
unwillingness to comply with this section.
      (6)   Any person whose application for a registration certificate has
been denied, suspended, or revoked may make written request for a hearing
before the Solid Waste Collection Review Board. The Solid Waste Collection
Review Board shall grant such hearing within a reasonable time after request is
made therefor.
      (7)   All registration certificates issued under this section shall
expire on December 31 of each year.
   (c)   Registration certificate required for bulky waste item collection.
      (1)   No person shall engage in the business of bulky waste item
collection for compensation, or as a required or voluntary service for others,
unless he possesses a valid registration certificate issued by the City
Manager.
      (2)   The City Manager shall issue registration certificates to collect
bulky waste items only to persons having proper equipment, as required by this
section, and personnel for collecting of bulky waste items, and agreeing to
comply with all conditions of issuance or possession of the registration
certificate and otherwise complying with the requirement of this section.
      (3)   Any person intending to collect bulky waste items shall make
written application for a registration certificate to the City on a form
provided by the City Manager. Such application shall contain the name and
address of such person, a description of the equipment to be used in the
collection of bulky waste items, the area where bulky waste items collections
are to be made and other information as the City Manager determines will
reasonably aid in the administration and enforcement of this section.
Applicant shall provide proof that all vehicles used by the applicant for the
collection and transportation of bulky waste have passed an annual inspection
conducted by the Health Commissioner. The inspection shall be arranged by the
applicant.
      (4)    On approval of such application and the determination that the
applicant has the proper equipment in good condition to meet the requirements
of this section, the City Manager shall issue a registration certificate to the
applicant which shall expire on December 31 of each year. The City Manager may
state on the registration certificate the conditions under which it is issued
to insure the proper collection of all bulky waste items in accordance with
this section. The registration fee per vehicle, payable annually to the City in
advance for the purpose of inspection, administration, and enforcement of this
section shall be as set forth by the City Manager and approved by the City
Commission.
      (5)   The City Manager may revoke or suspend the registration certificate
of any person to collect bulky waste items who has demonstrated inability or
unwillingness to comply with this section.
      (6)   Any person whose application for a registration certificate has
been denied, suspended, or revoked may make written request for a hearing
before the Solid Waste Collection Review Board. The Solid Waste Collection
Review Board shall grant such hearing within a reasonable time after request is
made therefor.
   (d)   Collection.
      (1)   All vehicles used for the collection and transportation of solid
waste, shall be compactor collection vehicles that have enclosed bodies with
special mechanical devices for loading the solid waste into the main
compartment of the bodies and for compressing and distributing the solid waste
within the body. The vehicle body shall be cleaned at sufficient frequency to
prevent odor, nuisance, or insect breeding, and shall be maintained in good
repair.
      (2)   Any person making application for a registration certificate to
collect solid waste shall present his equipment for inspection by the Health
Commissioner, or his authorized representative, to determine if applicant is in
compliance with subsection (b)(4) and (d)(1) hereof.
      (3)   Any person making application for a registration certificate to
collect solid waste shall have equipment to satisfactorily clean all vehicles
or containers used in the conduct of his business.
      (4)   The bed of vehicles used for the collection and transportation of
bulky waste shall be of durable construction and the end gate at least 24
inches high from the floor of the truck. The sides of the bed shall extend to a
minimum height of 5 feet. The maximum height of the vehicle and the ends of the
beds allowed is 13 feet 6 inches.
      (5)   Bulky waste items shall be stored in the collection vehicle in such
a manner to prevent the spillage or blowing of bulky waste items on City roads
and lands.
      (6)   Bulky waste collection vehicles are to be kept in a clean condition
that is satisfactory to the Board of Health.
      (7)   All dumpsters used for the storage of solid waste must be of
leakproof construction with tight-fitting lids which are to be kept closed. It
is the licensed hauler's responsibility to ensure that lids are closed after
completion of emptying the dumpsters. It is the proprietor's responsibility to
ensure that lids are closed at all other times.
      (8)   Dumpsters must be emptied a minimum of once every 7 days and
cleaned by the hauler as often as necessary to maintain them in a clean
condition and prevent undue odors.
      (9)   Before leaving the premises after emptying a dumpster, the licensed
hauler is to clean up any solid waste on the premises spilled during the
emptying of the dumpster.
   (e)   Insurance and identification required for collection vehicles.
      (1)   All vehicles used for the collection and transportation of solid
waste and bulky waste shall at all times be in good mechanical and operating
conditions and shall be covered by insurance in the amount of ten thousand
dollars ($10,000) per injury and twenty thousand dollars ($20,000) per accident
and ten thousand dollars ($10,000) for property damage.
      (2)   All vehicles used for the collection and transportation of solid
waste or bulky waste shall display in a conspicuous place, on both sides of the
vehicle, the name and telephone number of the person registering the vehicle.
The lettering shall be a minimum height of 2 inches.
         (Ord. 22-085. Passed 5-9-22.)
   955.06 IMPROPER DISPOSAL PROHIBITED.
   (a)   No person shall cast, place, sweep or deposit any garbage or other
refuse, or cause the same to be done, on or in the ground of any private or
public property, or on, along or near any street, highway, alley, road, park or
public ground, water or waterway, or sewer or ditch, except that garbage or
other refuse may be placed upon property, behind a line parallel to the front
of the building extended to the side lot lines, for purposes of collection
only, on the day it is to be collected. No person shall store or dispose of any
garbage or other refuse in any manner or way other than permitted or specified
in this chapter. The prohibition herein does not apply to disposal grounds or
works maintained or authorized by a public authority.
   (b)   No person shall burn garbage except in a disposal unit (as defined in
Section
955.01) which is located in an enclosed building. (Ord. 10-055. Passed 6-28-
10.)
   955.07 PERMITS FOR GARBAGE AND WASTE COLLECTORS; SCAVENGERS.
   No person shall engage in the collection and removal of the contents of
privy vaults or sewage tanks, swill, garbage, rubbish combustible or
noncombustible, or offal until a permit therefor is obtained from the
Department of Health or authority having charge of such operation. The permit
shall be issued for those periods of time as deemed advisable by the Department
of Health and shall state the conditions under which the material shall be
removed and method of disposal. Any permit may be revoked at any time by the
Department of Health for sufficient cause. (Ord. 10-055. Passed 6-28-10.)
   955.08 DEAD ANIMALS.
   No person shall place or deposit or permit to be placed or deposited the
carcass of a dead animal in any street, alley, road, open excavation, abandoned
well or cistern, ditch, stream, or body of water, or onto the surface of the
ground, or in any other manner deemed improper by the Department of Health. The
owner or occupant of the land on which the carcass of a dead animal is found
shall promptly provide for its proper removal and disposal. The carcass shall
be disposed of in a manner to avoid the creation of a nuisance or the
contamination of a water supply, by burning in a crematory suitable for the
purpose, by reduction in a plant operating under license of the State
Department of Agriculture, or by burial at least 3 feet of earth cover at a
point not less than 500 feet from any water supply, building of human
occupancy, road, or stream or body of water.
(Ord. 10-055. Passed 6-28-10.)
   955.09 COLLECTION.
   Except as otherwise specifically provided herein, all garbage and other
refuse, accumulated within the City of Sandusky, Ohio, shall be collected,
conveyed and disposed of by persons licensed for said purpose or purposes by
the City, and under the supervision and oversight of the Health Commissioner,
in full accordance with the law and regulations of the State of Ohio, the rules
and regulations of said Board of Health, and the Codified Ordinances of the
City of Sandusky, Ohio, as the same are applicable to said activity and
processes. No person who is not so licensed shall collect, convey and/or
dispose of any garbage or other refuse which has been accumulated within the
City.
(a)   This section shall not prohibit the actual producers of garbage or other
refuse, or the owners and/or occupants of premises wherein or whereupon it has
been produced, from personally collecting, conveying and/or disposing of the
same so long as said persons comply fully in said activity with the laws and
regulations of the State of Ohio, the rules and regulations of said Board of
Health, and the Codified Ordinances of the City of Sandusky, Ohio, as the same
are applicable to said activities and processes.
   (b)    Garbage and other refuse produced and/or accumulated in connection
with the use or occupation of a residence shall be collected and conveyed
therefrom at least once each week and, except as otherwise specifically set
forth herein, effected between the hours of 6:00 a.m. and 7:00 p.m. Monday
through Friday. Garbage and other refuse produced and/or accumulated in
connection with the use or occupation of a commercial establishment shall be
collected, conveyed and disposed of as follows:
      (1)    No person, business, firm or corporation engaged in the business
of hauling or disposing of solid waste shall collect, haul and dispose of
business, commercial or industrial solid waste at anytime other than between
the hours of 5:00 a.m. and 7:00 p.m., however, if such business, industrial or
commercial establishment is located within 150 yards of any residence,
residential duplex, apartment or complex collection, hauling and disposal shall
occur between the hours of 6:00 a.m. and 7:00 p.m.   
   (c)   Commercial haulers shall be permitted to effect the collection,
conveyance and/or disposal of garbage and other refuse produced and/or
accumulated in connection with the use or occupation of a residence on
Saturdays, between 6:00 a.m. and 7:00 p.m. if the occurrence of a legally
recognized holiday, mechanical failure or other verifiable circumstances make
collection on a weekday from Monday through Friday impracticable or impossible,
on the condition that prior to such Saturday collection, the Police Department
is notified of the intent of each commercial hauler to effect such collection,
conveyance and disposal on a specific Saturday, the identity of such hauler,
and the geographic area within which such process or activity will be effected.
Commercial hauler shall not collect, convey and dispose of garbage or other
refuse within the City on any Sunday.
   Commercial haulers shall be permitted to effect the removal, collection,
conveyance and/or disposal of garbage and other refuse or discarded material
created or produced as a result of or in conjunction with commercial or
industrial uses, especially in the area popularly known as the downtown
business district, on any day of the week, subject to the limitations imposed
in subsection (b)(1) above.
   (d)   All motor vehicles utilized by commercial haulers in the collection,
transportation and hauling within the City of bulky waste items, compostible
materials, garbage, refuse, other refuse, recyclables and/or solid waste at all
times during the course of any such activity shall be clearly marked on no
fewer than two sides of the same with the name of the commercial hauler
utilizing such vehicle, and with a number assigned thereto by the City Manager,
so that the identity of the commercial hauler is readily evident.
   (e)   The Board of Health of jurisdiction within the City through its Health
Commissioner, and the City Manager shall have and enjoy separate and concurrent
jurisdiction to effect compliance of this chapter and require that commercial
haulers operating within the City periodically provide to either such official
or the designee thereof, under the terms and conditions directed thereby, such
information and data as either official deems appropriate and necessary to
fully evaluate the success and progress of the recycling programs and the
recycling services required by this chapter.
      (Ord. 10-055. Passed 6-28-10.)
   955.10 LICENSE STICKERS; USE AND DISPLAY.
   (a)   As to each vehicle or piece of equipment utilized by a commercial
hauler licensed by the City of Sandusky, Ohio, for and in relation to
commercial collection activities within the City, the City Manager, or his or
her designee, upon proper inspection of the same, and the appropriate
certification of the compliance thereof with the Ordinances of the City, shall
issue, and cause to be affixed to the same, and to be prominently and visibly
displayed thereupon a licensure certificate sticker which shall be in effect,
and use for the balance of the calendar year of issuance.
   (b)   No vehicle or other piece of equipment shall be utilized for
commercial hauling activity within the City of Sandusky, Ohio, until and unless
a valid licensure certification sticker has been issued for the same, affixed
thereto, and prominently and visibly displayed thereupon, and said vehicle or
other piece of equipment shall be so used only during the effective period of
validity of the sticker.
   (c)   No person shall deface a valid and effective licensure certification
sticker, remove the same from its vehicle or piece of equipment of issuance, or
remove the same from its position of prominence and visibility thereupon until
and unless the vehicle or other piece of equipment has been removed from
ongoing commercial collection activity within the City of Sandusky, Ohio, or
until and unless a new or replacement sticker has been issued for said vehicle
or other piece of equipment, and is affixed thereto, and prominently and
visibly displayed thereupon.
   (d)   No person shall affix a licensure certification sticker to a vehicle
or other piece of equipment for which the same was not specifically issued, or
utilize the same in relation to such a vehicle or other piece of equipment for
which the same was not issued; utilize for commercial hauling activity within
the City of Sandusky, Ohio, any vehicle or piece of equipment for which a valid
licensure certification sticker has not been issued properly, and/or is not in
effect, or upon which a valid and effective licensure certification sticker is
not prominently and visibly displayed; or utilize for said purpose a vehicle or
piece of equipment upon which a licensure certification sticker issued for
another vehicle or piece of equipment has been affixed; or materially alter a
current licensure certification sticker, or an expired sticker for the purpose
of using the same as if it were a current sticker.
 
   (e)   All vehicles used for the collection and transportation of garbage,
shall be compactor collection vehicles that have enclosed bodies with special
mechanical devices for loading the garbage into the main compartment of the
bodies, and for the compressing and the distribution of the garbage within the
body. The vehicle body shall be cleaned with sufficient frequency so as to
prevent odor, nuisance, or insect breeding, and shall be maintained in good
order.
   (f)   Any person making application for a registration as a commercial
hauler shall present his or her equipment for inspection by the City as
required by this chapter to determine if the same are in full compliance
therewith.
   (g)   The beds of vehicles utilized for the collection or transportation of
bulky waste or of compostable material shall be of durable construction, and
the end gates of which shall be not less then twenty-four (24) inches high from
the floor of the collection vehicle. The sides of the collection bed shall
extend to a minimum height of not less than five (5) feet. The maximum height
of such vehicles and the ends of the beds allowed shall be thirteen feet (13'),
six (6) inches.
 
   (h)   Bulky waste items, and compostable material shall be stored in
collection vehicles in a manner so as to prevent the spillage or blowing of
items, or portions of the same onto roadways and lands.
   (i)   All dumpsters used by commercial haulers for the storage of discarded
material shall be of leakproof construction with tight-fitting lids which shall
be kept closed except as is necessary for the deposit into, or the removal of
items from the same. Commercial haulers shall ensure that the lids of dumpsters
are closed after the completion of the removal of material from the same, and
the occupant of the premises shall ensure that such lids are otherwise closed
except as may be necessary for the deposit of material into the same.
   (j)   Commercial dumpsters shall be emptied at least once during any seven
(7) day period, and shall be cleaned by the commercial hauler as often as is
necessary to maintain them in clean condition free of undue odor.
   (k)   Before leaving a premises after emptying a dumpster, the commercial
hauler shall clean up and remove any discarded material on the premises which
may have spilled over, or which may have been dropped or spilled during the
emptying process.
   (l)   Dumpsters shall not be stored or kept in the front yard of any
property. It shall be the responsibility, duty, and obligation of the
commercial haulers to place dumpsters in the rear yard of any premises in a
position which is not visible from the City street. The City Manager may
authorize the temporary placement of a dumpster in a front yard of a premises,
or, on a temporary basis, within the City right-of-way in conjunction with
major household clean-up, and/or reconstruction, repair, and/or demolition.
   (m)   All vehicles and other equipment used by commercial haulers shall be
in sound and safe operating condition, and shall be in full compliance with all
vehicle code requirements of the state of Ohio during the periods of use of the
same.
   (n)   The following insurance and identification shall be required for
collection vehicles utilized on a regular basis for commercial collection
activity within the City of Sandusky, Ohio:
(1)   All collection vehicles, at all times, shall be in good mechanical and
operating condition, and shall be covered by liability insurance in the amount
of five hundred thousand dollars ($500,000) per injury, and five hundred
thousand dollars ($500,000) per incident, together with a five hundred thousand
dollars ($500,000) property damage limit;
(2)   All collection vehicles shall display in conspicuous places, on both
sides of the vehicles, the name and telephone number of the hauler registering
the vehicle. The lettering shall be of a minimum height of four (4) inches.
         (Ord. 10-055. Passed 6-28-10.)
   955.11  RECYCLING SERVICES TO BE OFFERED.
   (a)   Subject to the provisions of this chapter, each licensed commercial
hauler engaged in the collection of garbage or refuse within the City of
Sandusky, Ohio, shall establish a recycling program, and hereafter shall offer
to the customers of said licensed commercial hauler recycling services, and,
then, and from time to time thereafter as directed by the City Manager each
licensed commercial hauler shall provide to said City Manager reasonably
adequate proof and documentation of said commercial hauler's full and complete
compliance with the provisions of Sections
 955.10 through
955.14.
   (b)   As a part of the recycling program of each commercial hauler, and/or
the recycling services provided thereby pursuant to this chapter and section,
each commercial hauler shall offer to each of the customers thereof the service
of collecting and conveying recyclables accumulated by each customer in
connection with the occupation or use of said customer within the City of
Sandusky. The collection and conveyance of recyclables required hereby shall be
offered by each commercial hauler to each customer thereof at such frequency as
said commercial hauler collects and conveys the garbage and/or refuse of each
customer.
   (c)   At the option of each commercial hauler, the recyclables collected
thereby shall be packaged and contained for curbside collection in one or the
other of the manners set forth below:
(1)   Placed completely within a bin, can, box, or other container with full
and solid sides and bottom made of plastic, or of galvanized or other
noncorrosive metal which is suitable for said purpose; which has clearly and
legibly marked thereupon the legend "RECYCLABLES"; which are of such size and/
or numbers as to be reasonably adequate to contain as to each occasion of
collection the recyclables produced by the occupation or use of said customer
within the City of Sandusky; or
(2)   Placed completely within solidly secured blue plastic bags of a strength
not less than 1.2 mils. and of a material through which in normal daylight
conditions the content thereof may be discerned with reasonable certainty by
use of the naked eye at a distance of four (4) feet or more;
   (d)   Containers in which recyclables are deposited as part of a curbside
collection program or services provided by a commercial hauler shall be used
exclusively to contain recyclables, and shall not be used to contain any other
solid waste, or any garbage, refuse or other discarded material.
   (e)   Recyclables which are collected by commercial haulers as part of
curbside collection programs or services contemplated hereby shall be disposed
of by said hauler exclusively for recycling, and shall not be delivered to and/
or disposed of at a landfill.
   (f)   Within a period of not more than ninety (90) days after the enactment
of this section, the City of Sandusky shall cause notice of said enactment, and
a summary of the recycling program and services which are required hereby to be
offered to be published once each week for two (2) consecutive weeks in a
newspaper of general circulation within the City of Sandusky, Ohio, and shall
further cause copies thereof to be delivered to each of the users of the sewer
and/or water services of the City which are contained within the municipal
limits thereof by enclosing the same within each person's water and/or sewer
billing. Thereafter, each commercial hauler within a period of not more than
fifteen (15) days after said commercial hauler contracts for or agrees to the
provision of services to a person in the collection, conveyance or disposal of
garbage, solid waste, refuse, and/or other discarded materials or to the
reinitiation of the same, shall provide to each person notice of the content of
this section, and a summary of the recycling program which are required hereby
to be offered, in such written manner and form as the City Manager deems
appropriate. Further, once each year, beginning with the calendar year 1996,
and thereafter, each commercial hauler engaged in the collection and removal of
garbage, refuse, and/or recyclables shall provide to each of his or her
customers during the months of March, April, or May, written notice of the
availability and cost of recycling services. As part of the licensing process
of commercial haulers under this chapter, on an annual basis, each commercial
hauler engaged in the collection and removal of garbage, refuse, and/or
recyclables within the City of Sandusky shall provide to the City of Sandusky,
Ohio, adequate and appropriate demonstration of his or her compliance for the
prior year with the written notice requirements of this section. Failure of any
such commercial hauler to comply fully with the notice requirements of this
section, or to afford the City demonstration of the same shall be and
constitute grounds for the refusal of the issuance of license under this
chapter.
(Ord. 10-055. Passed 6-28-10.)
   955.11.1 REPORTS REQUIRED.
   All commercial haulers shall report quarterly on April 15, July 15, October
15, and January 15, to the Board of Health on a form provided by the Health
Commissioner with information necessary to track the volume of recyclable
materials collected and where disposed of, participation by residents, volume
of solid waste collected, and location of disposal.
(Ord. 10-055. Passed 6-28-10.)
   955.12  COLLECTION PERMITTED. 
   Commercial curbside collection activity which involves the collection or
removal of garbage, refuse, and other discarded material created or produced as
a result of or in conjunction with residential occupation or use, but excluding
the collection or removal of bulky waste items, or compostable material, and
the collection or removal of any discarded material created or produced as a
result of or in conjunction with commercial or industrial uses, shall be
permitted in conjunction with the activities of commercial haulers who are in
compliance with the requirements of this chapter as set forth in this section.
(a)   For the purpose of limiting and restricting said curbside collection, the
City of Sandusky, Ohio, is hereby divided into five (5) geographic zones as
illustrated in a "Curbside Collection Zone Map" which is incorporated herein by
reference and copies of which shall be continuously maintained on file and
available for public inspection with the Clerk of the City Commission of the
City of Sandusky, Ohio, and the City Manager of the City of Sandusky, Ohio,
who, upon reasonable request, shall make a copy thereof available to any person
at such cost as is necessary to cover the actual expense of the reproduction
thereof;
(b)   Such curbside collection activity shall be permitted and allowed within
each curbside collection zone on the one day each week set forth hereinbelow in
relation to each zone, and otherwise in full compliance with this chapter:
(1)   Zone 1-Monday;
(2)   Zone 2-Tuesday;
(3)   Zone 3-Wednesday;
(4)   Zone 4-Thursday; and
(5)   Zone 5-Friday.
(c)   Collection other than in full compliance with the provisions of this
Chapter and this section is prohibited.
(d)   This section shall be applicable to the collection or removal by licensed
commercial haulers of residential garbage, refuse, or recyclables, but shall
not be applicable to or restrictive upon the collection or removal by licensed
commercial haulers of discarded material created or produced as a result of or
in conjunction with commercial or industrial uses, or the collection or removal
of compostable material, or bulky waste items.
      (Ord. 10-055. Passesd 6-28-10.)
   955.13 OWNERSHIP OF SOLID WASTE AND RECYCLABLES.
   All solid waste, garbage, refuse, and other discarded materials, and solid
waste placed upon a curb as part of a curbside collection program or curbside
collection services shall be and become the property of the commercial hauler
charged with the responsibility of collecting and conveying the same, and no
person other than said commercial hauler, or the authorized agents and/or
employees thereof shall collect or remove the same. Nothing herein shall
prohibit the occupant of the premises upon or within which said items were
produced or accumulated from removing any items previously placed by said
occupant upon a curb at the premises occupied thereby, provided the same are
removed by the occupant of the premises prior to the initiation by the licensed
commercial hauler of the actual collection and removal of the same.
(Ord. 10-055. Passed 6-28-10.)
   955.14 CONTAINING SOLID WASTE.
   All solid waste, garbage, refuse, and other discarded material, other than
recyclables, which is placed upon a curb for curbside collection shall be
placed within a can or box of plastic or of galvanized or other noncorrosive
metal which is constructed to be watertight, which has suitable handles on the
outside thereof, and which is fitted with a tight, fitted cover which shall be
removed therefrom only when necessary for the deposit or removal of material
therefrom, or in watertight plastic bags of a color other than blue which are
solidly closed and secured. Garbage which is stored or kept at any place
outside of a fully enclosed structure shall be placed within a can or box of
plastic, or of galvanized or other noncorrosive metal which is constructed to
be watertight, and which is fitted with a tight, fitted cover, which shall be
removed only when necessary for the deposit or removal of material.
(Ord. 10-055. Passed 6-28-10.)
   955.15  LIMITATIONS ON CURBSIDE PLACEMENT.
   Containers within which solid waste, garbage, refuse and/or other discarded
materials, or recyclables have been deposited may be placed upon a curb for
curbside collection no earlier than 6:00 p.m. from April 1 through September 30
and no earlier than 4:00 p.m. from October 1 through March 31, on the evening
prior to the scheduled collection of said material, and any such materials or
containers which remain after said collection shall be removed from said curb
no later than 8:00 p.m. on the date of said collection.
(Ord. 17-050. Passed 3-13-17.)
   955.16 CONDITION OF RECYCLABLE MATERIALS PLACED FOR CURBSIDE COLLECTION. 
   Any and all recyclable materials which are placed for curbside collection
under a recycling program instituted and operating pursuant to this chapter
shall comply with the requirements of this section, and of such other
reasonable regulations as the City Manager may from time to time prescribe, and
make publicly known:
(a)   Cardboard and corrugated paper shall be neatly stacked separate from
other material, bundled, and securely tied;
(b)   Newsprint shall be neatly stacked separate from other material, bundled
and securely tied;
(c)   Plastics, container glass, and aluminum and bi-metal beverage cans which
previously contained food or liquid prepared or proposed for human or animal
consumption shall be washed so as to render the same reasonably clean and free
of residual content.
   (Ord. 10-055. Passed 6-28-10.)
   955.17 KEEPING GARBAGE IN VEHICLES.
   (a)    No person shall keep, or shall permit or suffer the keeping of
garbage or other refuse in a vehicle, or in any other piece of equipment which
is parked or placed upon the streets, public grounds, public thoroughfares, or
public rights-of-way of the City of Sandusky, Ohio;
   (b)    No person shall keep, or shall permit or suffer the keeping of
garbage or other refuse in any vehicle or other piece of equipment which is
kept within the City of Sandusky, Ohio, outside of a fully enclosed structure
for a period in excess of forty-eight (48) hours;
   (c)    No person shall keep, or shall permit or suffer the keeping of
garbage or other refuse within the City of Sandusky, Ohio, in such manner as to
cause or to create a condition of nuisance to others as a result of the
condition, odor, or appearance of the same.
(Ord. 10-055. Passed 6-28-10.)
   955.18  NO MANURE IN GARBAGE CANS.
   No person shall place or deposit manure, produced by the keeping of an
animal of the horse, mule, or cattle kind, in any street, alley, road, open
excavation, abandoned well or cistern, ditch, stream or body of water, or in
any other manner deemed improper by the Department of Health. Every person
owning or keeping in a stable, stall, or compartment, any animal of the horse,
mule, or cattle kind, shall store the manure in a manner satisfactory to the
Department of Health. (Ord. 10-055. Passed 6-28-10.)
   955.19  NUISANCES.
   Where a health and sanitation nuisance, as defined in Ohio R.C. 3767.13, is
found in any building or upon any ground or premises, a written order to abate
the nuisance shall be given by the Department of Health to the owner or
occupant of the building or premises. The time for compliance therewith shall
be specified in the order. (Ord. 10-055. Passed 6-28-10.)
   955.20  ACCUMULATION AND STORING OF GARBAGE AND OTHER REFUSE.
   (a)   Garbage accumulated by any person shall be accumulated and stored only
in proper containers for collection.
   
   (b)   Garbage containers must have their covers securely in place at all
times except when garbage is being deposited therein or when being removed
therefrom for the purpose of being disposed of.
   (c)   Other refuse shall be stored only in proper containers for collection
and shall not be allowed to accumulate outside thereof longer than 7 days.
   (d)   Any unauthorized accumulation of garbage or other refuse on any
premises is hereby declared to be a nuisance and is prohibited.
   (e)   Used lumber and building materials, firewood and any other material
that is not piled solidly and without harborage or nesting places for rodents
shall be placed on a framework or other supports so that the bottom of the pile
is at least 18 inches above the surface of the ground. Legs or posts for the
devices must be provided with rat guards.
   (f)   The composting of grass clippings or other cut vegetation, not
including leaves, is prohibited except when supported as described in
subsection (e) hereof.
   (g)   Upholstered furniture, automobile seats, mattresses, and similar
items, when not inside a residence and constituting possible harborage or
nesting places for rodents shall be kept not less than 18 inches above the
highest contiguous ground during the time between sunset and sunrise. These
items when stored in garages, sheds, barns, or other outbuildings shall be
supported as described in subsection (e) hereof. (Ord. 10-055. Passed 6-28-10.)
   955.21  STORAGE CONTAINERS.
   (a)   Duty to provide and maintain in sanitary condition. Storage containers
shall be provided by the owner, tenant, lessee, or occupant of premises. They
shall be maintained in good condition. Any such container that does not conform
to the provisions of this chapter or that may have ragged or sharp edges or any
other defect liable to hamper or injure the person collecting the contents
thereof shall be promptly replaced upon notice.
   (b)   Garbage and refuse containers shall be made of galvanized or
noncorrosive metal or other material approved by the Health Commissioner
equipped with suitable handles and tight-fitting covers and shall be
watertight. They shall be kept in a neat, clean, and sanitary condition at all
times.
(Ord. 10-055. Passed 6-28-10.)
   955.22 DISPOSAL OF GARBAGE.
   All garbage and refuse accumulated and stored in the City shall be conveyed
to an approved sanitary landfill and disposed of there, except that garbage and
refuse as it is produced may be disposed of in a disposal unit approved by the
Board of Health or on special permit issued by the Board of Health, in the
manner and way as directed by the Health Commissioner.
(Ord. 10-055. Passed 6-28-10.)
   955.23 FEEDING OF WILDLIFE AND DOMESTICATED ANIMALS OR FOWL.
   (a)   It shall be unlawful for any person to feed wild birds other than in
suitable containers for the food, elevated at least 48 inches above ground
level.
   (b)   It shall be unlawful for any person to feed other wildlife, on public
or private property, in quantities in excess of that which will be consumed
during the daylight hours of the day of the instant feeding.
   (c)   It shall be unlawful for any person to place food for the feeding of
domesticated fowl, birds or animals except in the containers as will prevent
the scattering of the food upon the ground. After the feeding, the food shall
not be allowed to remain where it is available to rodents.
(Ord. 10-055. Passed 6-28-10.)
   955.24  RODENT-INFESTED PREMISE A NUISANCE.
   It shall be unlawful for the owner, tenant, lessee, or occupant of any
premises to maintain them in a vermin- or rodent-infested condition, or permit
any premises to become so infested. These infested premises are declared a
nuisance. (Ord. 10-055. Passed 6-28-10.)
   955.25  RODENT CONTROL.
   It shall be the duty of the Health Commissioner to cause an inspection of
any premises he has good reason to believe is not in rodent-proof condition, or
which he has good reason to believe is or may become infested with vermin or
rodents, and for this purpose he or his authorized representative is permitted
to enter upon the premises at all reasonable times. If the premises are found
to be so infested or likely to become so infested the Health Commissioner shall
cause a notice thereof to be served upon the owner, tenant, lessee, or occupant
of the premises of their condition and what is required to correct this
condition. The notice may be served by sending the same in a postpaid envelope
properly addressed by certified mail. Failure to comply with the terms of the
notice in 10 days after receipt shall constitute a misdemeanor.
(Ord. 10-055. Passed 6-28-10.)
   955.26 NOTICE FOR ACCUMULATION OF GARBAGE, TRASH, DEBRIS, OR OTHER REFUSE ON
BOULEVARDS AND OTHER PUBLIC RIGHT-OF-WAYS; AND REMEDIATION THEREOF.
   (a)   Purpose: Whereas the accumulation of garbage, trash, debris, or other
refuse in or on the boulevards and public right of ways poses a major health,
sanitation, and quality of life risks it is deemed a public nuisance and as
such it shall be abated effectively and efficiently.
 
   (b)   Any property in violation of Section
955.15 which is found to have any garbage, trash, debris, or other refuse in or
on the boulevard or public right of way shall be declared a nuisance and may be
immediately abated so long as the annual notice publication related to the
requirements of this section has been published in a newspaper of general
circulation for the City of Sandusky. No additional notice of a violation will
be given.
 
   (c)   The costs to abate the nuisance along with an administrative fee of
one hundred dollars ($100.00) shall be assessed to the property owner or the
City may use any other legal manner of collection.
 
   (d)   Any appeal in this matter shall be filed in writing, to the City
Manager or his/her designee, within ten (10) days of the abatement or the
assessment of the abatement, whichever occurs last.
(Ord. 15-146. Passed 10-26-15.)
   955.99  PENALTY.
   (a)   Any person, other than a licensed commercial hauler, who violates any
provision of Sections
 955.02 through
955.14 in relation to the keeping, collection, removal, or disposition of
garbage, solid waste, refuse, compostables, bulky waste items, or other
discarded material produced in relation to or in conjunction with the use or
occupancy of said individual shall be fined not more than one hundred and fifty
dollars ($150.00). Any organization, as defined and found criminally liable in
the manner set forth in Ohio R.C. 2901.23, who violates any provision of
Sections
955.02 through
 955.14 in relation to the keeping, collection, removal or disposition of
garbage, solid waste, refuse, compostables, bulky waste items, or other
discarded material produced in relation to or in conjunction with the use or
occupancy of said organization shall be fined not less than five hundred
dollars ($500.00) and not more than two thousand dollars ($2,000). For the
purposes of said sections, each calendar day or portion thereof during which a
violation occurs, exists or continues shall constitute and be a separate
violation and offense.
   (b)   Any licensed commercial hauler, or any other person engaged in
commercial hauling activity within the City of Sandusky, Ohio, who violates any
provision of Sections
955.02 through
955.14 shall be fined one hundred dollars ($100.00) for the first such
violation within any period of twenty-four (24) months, and two hundred fifty
dollars ($250.00) for the second such offense within such period, and shall be
fined five hundred dollars ($500.00), and shall be subject to imprisonment of
not more than thirty (30) days for each subsequent violation during said
period. For the purposes of said sections, each calendar day or portion thereof
during which a violation occurs exists, or continues shall constitute and be a
separate violation and offense. In addition to the penalties provided
hereunder, the third such violation by a commercial hauler licensed to engage
in commercial collection activity within the City of Sandusky, Ohio, within any
period of twenty-four (24) months shall result in the suspension of the license
thereof to operate within the City of Sandusky, Ohio, as a commercial hauler
for a period of one (1) year. In addition to the penalties provided hereunder,
any violation by an unlicensed commercial hauler in relation to the commercial
activity of the same within the City of Sandusky, Ohio, shall preclude said
commercial hauler from securing or receiving licensing under this chapter as a
commercial hauler licensed to engage in commercial hauling activity within the
City of Sandusky, Ohio, for a period of twenty-four (24) months.
   (c)   Any person who violates any provision of Sections
955.06,
955.09 or
955.20 through
955.25 shall be fined not less than fifty dollars ($50.00) or more than two
hundred dollars ($200.00), or imprisoned not more than thirty (30) days or
both. Any organization, as defined and found criminally liable in the manner
set forth in Ohio R.C. 2901.23, which violates any provision of Sections
955.02 through
955.14 or Sections
955.20 through
955.25, in relation to the keeping, collection, removal or disposition of
garbage, solid waste, refuse, compostables, bulky waste items, or other
discarded material produced in relation to or in conjunction with the use or
occupancy of said organization shall be fined not less than five hundred
dollars ($500.00) and not more than two thousand dollars ($2,000).
   (d)   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter for which a penalty is
not otherwise specifically provided shall be subject of a fine not to exceed
one hundred and fifty dollars ($150.00). Any organization, as defined and found
criminally liable in the manner set forth in Ohio R.C. 2901.23, which violates
any provision of this chapter for which a penalty is not otherwise specifically
provided shall be subject to a fine of not less than two hundred and fifty
dollars ($250.00) and not more than one thousand dollars ($1,000).
(Ord. 10-055. Passed 6-28-10.)
                                                                                                   
CHAPTER 957
Solid Waste Collection Review Board
957.01   Establishment; powers; members.
957.02   Procedure.
CROSS REFERENCES
      Open meetings - see ADM
113.03 et seq.
   957.01  ESTABLISHMENT; POWERS; MEMBERS.
   (a)   There is hereby created and established the Solid Waste Collection
Review Board of the City of Sandusky, Ohio, in which there is vested the power
and authority of hearing and deciding appeals of individuals aggrieved by any
action of the City Manager or the designee of said individual pursuant to or
under the terms and provisions of Section
955.09 to ensure the full and complete compliance with the same in relation to
the facts and circumstances pertaining thereto.
   (b)   The Board shall consist of three (3) members all of whom shall be
qualified electors of the City, and one (1) of whom shall be an individual with
experience, education, and/or expertise in the area of solid waste hauling,
conveyance, and/or disposal, and/or recycling processes.
   (c)   The members of said Board shall be appointed by the City Commission to
three (3) year terms and shall serve thereafter during the course of the same
and during the period of qualification thereof, or until the successor thereof
shall be appointed and qualified, and shall receive no compensation for their
service.
   (d)   The Board may designate one of its members or an employee of the City,
who shall act as the Clerk of the Board, and who shall take, keep, and maintain
the records and minutes of the Board, and upon whom service as to all matters
related to the Board may be effected.
   (e)   Vacancies as to members of the Board shall be filled in the same
manner in which original appointments are effected.
(Ord. 95-181. Passed 10-23-95.)
   957.02  PROCEDURE.
   (a)   Appeals to the Board shall be effected in writing upon a form prepared
and provided by the City Manager, and available at the offices of said official
during regular business hours within a period of fourteen days after the action
or omission in relation to which the appeal is pursued.
   (b)   A public hearing shall be held on any such appeal within a period of
thirty days after its receipt by the City, upon notice to all interested
parties who shall be afforded the privilege and opportunity of appearing,
personally or through a representative, of offering testimony and evidence in
relation to the matter, and of cross-examining adverse witnesses as part of
said proceedings. All testimony offered as part of said proceedings shall be
given under oath. At the discretion of the Board, and where appropriate under
the circumstances, the Board may receive and accept as evidence the sworn
statements of persons not present at such a hearing. The Law Director, or his
or her designated assistant shall attend each such hearing, and shall advise
the Board as to legal matters related to the same. At the request of the
appellant, the Board shall cause any such hearing to be recorded by audio
recording means. Either the City or the appellant, at the expense of the same,
may arrange for the stenographic or video recording of any such hearing.
   (c)   Decisions of the Board based upon the concurring vote of no fewer than
two of its members shall be rendered within a period of fourteen days after any
such hearing. If the decision of the Board is not pronounced at the conclusion
of a hearing and in the context of the same, the decision shall be rendered in
written form, and shall be delivered to the appellant at his or her place of
business or place of residence as reflected in the record of said proceedings
within said time period, by premises delivery, or by certified or registered
United States mail.
   (d)   Any person aggrieved by a decision of the Board may appeal the same to
the Common Pleas Court of Erie County, Ohio, by filing written notice of such
appeal with the Clerk of said Court, and by serving a copy of the same upon the
Board no later than fourteen days after the entry of the decision of the Board
and notice of the same to the appellant. In any such appeal, the Board, and not
its individual members shall appear as appellee in the matter, and shall be
represented therein by the Law Director, or his or her designated assistant.
   (e)   The Board may adopt, and from time to time amend such other procedural
rules and regulations for and in relation to the conduct of its business, and
the discharge of its duties and responsibilities as it deems appropriate, and
which do not conflict with the provisions of this chapter and other applicable
provisions of law. Decisions of the Board shall be based upon and in compliance
with these Codified Ordinances and shall not conflict therewith.
(Ord. 95-181. Passed 10-23-95.)
                                                                                                  
CHAPTER 961
Emergency Medical Services
961.01   Charges.
961.02   Rules and regulations; incidental charges.
CROSS REFERENCES
   Emergency medical services - see Ohio R.C. Ch. 4765
   961.01  CHARGES.
   (a)   Users of the emergency medical/ambulance services of the City shall
pay, and be responsible for the charges set forth hereinbelow:
      (1)   For each basic life support run: five hundred sixteen dollars
($516.00);
      (2)   For each advanced life support (ALS 1) run: six hundred dollars
($600.00):
      (3)   For each advanced life support II run (ALS II) seven hundred fifty
dollars ($750.00)
      (4)   For each run - an additional mileage charge of thirteen and 20/100
dollars ($13.20) per mile or any portion of the same.
   (b)   The fees set in this chapter shall be subject to annual review by the
City Manager and to annual modification and adjustment in conformity with the
usual and customary charges in the industry. Each such annual review shall be
conducted prior to August 1, and any modifications and adjustments effected in
relation thereto shall be effective on and after January 1, next thereafter.
   (c)   The initial sum of four hundred thousand dollars ($400,000) generated
annually by the fees, rates, and charges provided in this chapter shall be
utilized to defray the costs of operation of the Division of Fire. Any amounts
generated annually by the fees, rates and charges in excess of the sum of four
hundred thousand dollars ($400,000) shall be attributed to and become part of
the funds and accounts related to the Division of Fire and shall be used to
defray the costs of equipment, capital improvements directly related to the
operation and provision of Fire and Emergency Medical/Ambulance Services, as
well as for the remediation and removal of blighted structures as deemed
necessary by the Fire Chief and the Director of Community Development (or his/
her designee).
   This allocation of fees, rates, and charges shall be reviewed by the City
Commission, upon the report and recommendation of the City Manager, during the
annual budget process of the City.
(Ord. 24-158. Passed 8-26-24.)
   961.02 RULES AND REGULATIONS; INCIDENTAL CHARGES.
   (a)   The City Manager shall promulgate and publish rules and regulations,
and shall establish other charges, fees, and rates incidental to the operation
of the emergency medical/ambulance services of the City, and which the City
Manager deems necessary and advisable, and shall file these rules, regulations,
charges, fees and rates with the Clerk of the City Commission.
   (b)   The City Manager, further, shall establish procedures for the
collection and recovery of the charges, fees, and rates established in relation
to the emergency medical/ambulance services of City provided.
(Ord. 05-058. Passed 1-10-05.)

CODIFIED ORDINANCES OF SANDUSKY
PART ELEVEN - PLANNING AND ZONING CODE
TITLE ONE - Zoning Administration
         Chap.   
1105.   Purpose and Interpretation
         Chap.
